runs.comm: flighted on middle, no turn just yet as this is worked away to short fine leg
there's the turn. Good length ball on off stump, nudged off his thighs
flighted on middle, kept out
this turns from off stump and beats his forward defensive to strike him on the front pad. Mild appeal, too much turn
looped up just outside off and this turns across to strike his pads again
short with a bit of width and Tamim has slapped it to point. Good timing from the returning left-hander
back of a length and angled across him, Anamul punches off the back foot and gets an outside edge to deep third man
cuts him in half as this length ball curves back in! Shapoor's height is working for him. Tamim is late on the defensive push and is beaten comfortably
comes down the track and carves this through cover. Reached almost to the pitch of it and has flayed this fuller ball with a bit of width
137kph, short ball outside off, Tamim preferred to be on the front foot and slapped it to the man at cover.
140kph, shortish on leg stump, he goes for a one-legged pull but hasn't timed it properly. Little too quick for him
appreciable turn and bounce, and more puffs of dust! He was going forward to defend, but the ball goes well past his outside edge
good length ball, grips into the surface and bounces rather sharply. He refrains from playing outside off
good length ball angled in on off, but the batsman banks on the turn and bounce and leaves
pitched a little too full that time on off stump as he drives through extra
tossed up rather full again as Anamul comes forward and drives to long-off
driven through extra again as Tamim takes a good stride to reach the pitch of the flighted ball on off
lots of flight and he prefers to play back. Makes room and just about carves to point.
big outside edge and the keeper's dropped it. Flatter and fuller just outside off and he goes back to cut again. Thick outside edge is shelled
makes room again and cuts to short third man, who lets it sneak right through him. Terribly work from Dawlat
flighted and this one doesn't turn. Strikes him on the back pad as he was looking to sweep, but this would have gone down the angle and past leg stump
flighted, he comes forward and pushes down the ground
comes forward and his front foot is planted outside off so he can work this tossed up ball towards square leg
flighted on leg stump, comes forward and pushes back to the bowler
comes forward to block the tossed up ball on middle and off
pushed towards point and they sneak a quick single. Nicely done
little bit of drift takes this loopy delivery outside off and then after pitching it tucks him up. Gets an inside edge on the forward press
good length ball on off stump, bunted off the back foot
too much flight on this as he gets under this one and sends it over the long-on boundary. Full swing of the arms and he hit it straight
flighted on off stump, driven to long-off
short ball and he's played it with the turn and helped it along to the fine leg boundary. Too flat and the line was taking the ball down leg as well. Pulled past the man inside the circle
charges down the track and smashes him over long-on. The fielder goes back and leaps as far as he could, but it evades his outstretched hand
flighted on off stump, defended
shortish on middle and leg, pulled to square leg
comes down the track and smacks this through midwicket. Reached the pitch and refused to let this turn. Even if it had, he was looking to along with it. Nice flick
back of a length on leg stump, flicked away to deep square leg
shortish and a bit wide of off stump, Anamul was going to smack it over point but it's too quick for him
charges him and ensured he had enough room to hack this short ball just outside off to deep point
143kph, continues bowling short and Tamim has punished him. Goes back and pulls well in front of square. No worries about the extra pace for him
one-legged pull to deep midwicket and they've snared a couple with some good running, and of course the placement of that shot

fullish on off stump, pushed back to the bowler. Dawlat unleashes a furious throw back at the stumps and Tamim protects himself with the bat. Dawlat says he was obstructing the stumps but the batsman had already moved back to safety
tossed up and this turns outside off, Anamul stays back and cuts to deep point
shortish and just a bit of room on offer, Tamim rocks back and punches to cover
lovely shot that time as he waited for the short ball outside off and dabbed it to backward point

that's the first pin down, Tamim stretched forward to defend but he was playing down the wrong line. This grips the pitch and turns a touch to strike him low on the front pad in front of middle. Think that might have clipped leg
good length ball, slightly quicker too. He stays back and blocks relatively solidly
he's learned from that last ball. Strides forward to this one and turns to square leg
back of a length on off stump, Anamul drops and runs to cover
fullish and pushed across him, Shakib looks for a shovel-drive through the off side and misses
length ball on leg stump, turned away behind square leg and they've sneaked a couple. This is great running from these two

142kph, short ball and it beats him for pace. This was gloved while he was looking to pull and it lobs up and drops beside the stumps. Dawlat snarls at the batsman and I think he was almost looking to push Shakib as well. Continues his one-sided convo with Shakib before he has to be pulled away. The umpires have dragged Nabi to one side and both of them are demanding that he keep his players under leash
full on leg stump, comes forward and looks to flick and doesn't connect
goes for another flick and again, he hasn't connected. The keeper throws the ball up and is sure he's nicked that. Far too excitable is Shahzad. The wide has been avoided though
good length ball, looks to flick it off the back foot and again no luck in making contact
good length ball on leg stump, turned away to square leg
tossed up and its slower just outside off, Anamul is forward and looks to defend. Beaten
tossed up on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on

slogged away to the deep midwicket boundary. Comes down the track and took this from outside off. Went more off the bottom, inside half of the bat but he had struck it well enough to beat the fielder in the deep
charges him but this is shorter and doesn't turn. Tapped into the covers for a quick single
full and flat on off stump, comes forward to defend
great commitment from the captain. This was pushed and seemed to find the gap between short cover and mid-off, but Nabi runs to his right and dives to keep that to no run
fullish and just outside off, driven on the up and down the ground
full toss on leg stump and Anamul has helped it to the fine leg boundary. Very little effort needed to capitalise on those kind of balls
lengthon leg stump again. Anamul picks it away to the left of short fine leg.
good length ball on middle and leg, pushed down to mid-on and they scurry through for a quick single
low full toss outside off, sliced through to deep cover

makes room and smashes it over the gap at extra cover! Solid stroke! Opened the face on impact and he's muscled it away. Not too happy with the execution though as he shadow practices it. Think he wanted to hit that over the ropes
good length ball on middle and leg, turned away behind square leg
flighted on off stump, comes forward to block. Head right over the ball, very eye-catching
flighted on off stump, he clears his front leg and bludgeons down the ground. Shenwari gets a boot to it and it loops up to his hand and he hurls it at the stumps. Anamul has made his ground though
good length ball, which grips, turns and bounces to beat the little dab. Pushed the back-half of his back leg into the crease.
loads of bounce again! Leaps up from off stump and he pulls his bat back. Was originally looking to block

seals it with a six and then screams his lungs out! This was tossed up on middle and leg and he charged down the track and swats it over the long-on boundary. Scythes the air with his bat in furious delight
